events.1830: Ram Mohun Roy sailed for England. He was the first Indian Brahmin (then 'Brahmo') to go to England.
events.1875: Birsa Munda, freedom fighter and leader, was born at Ulihatu, Ranchi district, Bihar.
events.1911: First meeting of the governing body of the Indian Research Fund Association (IRFA) was held at the Plague Laboratory, Bombay, under the Chairmanship of Sir Harcourt Butler.
events.1913: Rabindranath Tagore (1861-1941), received the message that he was awarded with Noble Prize in literature for his collection of poems "Gitanjali" . He was the first Indian to be awarded with Noble Prize.
events.1920: Assembly meeting of the League of Nations.
events.1921: 16 Gurkha troops killed by anti-British rebels.
events.1932: Surinder Kumar Mehra, Air Chief Marshal, was born in Delhi.
events.1937: Jayshankar Prasad, famous Hindi writer, died. His works include the epic (mahakavya) "Kamayanee" and plays "Chandra Gupt" and "Skand Gupt".
events.1949: Nathuram Vinayak Godse and Narayan Dattatreya Apte were hanged in Ambala Jail for Gandhi's murder.
events.1982: S. N. Katkar, famous poet and former editor of 'Yugvani', died.
events.1988: Dalai Lama agreed for less then independent country to save the cultural heritage of Tibet.
events.1989: Test debut of Sachin Tendulkar and Waqar Yunus at Karachi.
events.1991: Insurance official Dr. S.L. Khosa freed in Kashmir in exchange for a militant.
events.1992: Praveen Amre scores century (103) on Test Cricket debut vs South Africa at Durban.
events.1993: Supreme Court rules that the CEC is supreme.
events.1995: Qiao Shi, Chairman of the standing committee of the Chinese National Peoples' Congress, arrives in New Delhi to advance Sino-Indian relations.
events.1998: Naresh & Girdhari Lal Yadav win the National Enterprise sailing championship in Mumbai.
events.1999: The no-confidence motion moved against Om Prakash Chautala by the opposition failed in Haryana.
events.2000: Congress(I) gives a thumping mandate to Sonia Gandhi.
